body: "He [PM Saad Hariri] has already brought his “price” down by exonerating Syria ... He has also exonerated Hizbullah’s leadership from any connection with the crime ... All that’s left is for him to join his opponents in claiming that the STL [Special Tribunal for Lebanon] was infiltrated by Israel and that his father was the victim of a Zionist plot," writes Qifa Nabki about the the Syrian-Saudi negotiations over the fate of the STL.
original_body: "He [PM Saad Hariri] has already brought his “price” down by exonerating Syria ... He has also exonerated Hizbullah’s leadership from any connection with the crime ... All that’s left is for him to join his opponents in claiming that the STL [Special Tribunal for Lebanon] was infiltrated by Israel and that his father was the victim of a Zionist plot," writes Qifa Nabki about the the Syrian-Saudi negotiations over the fate of the STL.
title: Lebanon: Negotiating the fate of STL

sentence: "He [PM Saad Hariri] has already brought his “price” down by exonerating Syria ...

He has also exonerated Hizbullah’s leadership from any connection with the crime ... All that’s left is for him to join his opponents in claiming that the STL [Special Tribunal for Lebanon] was infiltrated by Israel and that his father was the victim of a Zionist plot," writes Qifa Nabki about the the Syrian-Saudi negotiations over the fate of the STL.
